intro: Michelia gioi, commonly known as the fragrant Michelia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Magnoliaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth, glossy surface. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and bloom in late spring to early summer.
